intro: Sphaeralcea fendleri var. elongata, commonly known as the elongated globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are lance-shaped with serrated edges. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy species adapted to arid environments. Sphaeralcea fendleri var. elongata is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of these regions.
